title: Keen Dreams speedrun
content:
For the last week I've been playing Keen Dreams in an attempt to finish it as fast as possible - no other restrictions. Right now, I've clocked a perfect run (in 2 segments) at about 7 mins 30 sec, getting 6 bombs from Rhubarb Rapids and Grape Grove and then getting the other 6 bombs from Apple Acres and Spud City. I know there must be a way to dramatically speed this up by getting all 6 bombs in Spud City, but I have no idea how. I've been able to get them, but not to get back up from the secret passage. Can anybody help?

P.S. Same for Apple Acres, but I don't think those extra 3 bombs are even physically possible to get.

title: Re: Keen Dreams speedrun
content:
I think theres a secret passage to the ones in apple acres.
Look at the map on CC314. See how it's got a flower pot thats inside the ceiling a little bit?[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v609/genius314/picturekeen.bmp[/img]

title: Re: Keen Dreams speedrun
content:
It helps to download modkeen and redo the secret tiles. There is a secret passage [very hard to enter if you don't know where!] in the left side of the pole cavity below the end. When down there you can pole climb back up. This needs practice however!

In spud city you can either jump back up from where you came down or got to the right of the chamber and jump up and left.A proud member of the signature stealing society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/Kazz.gif[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: Keen Dreams speedrun
content: Kinda reminds me something... I once saw a movie clip called "Super Mario Bros. 3 - Time Attack" - it's a clip where you see some great stuff - a guy finishing Super Mario Bros. 3 in 11 minutes![img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img] Couldn't he just use the pogo!?

title: Re: Keen Dreams speedrun
content: Hi, that's a nice time! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Good luck improving it.You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: yes
content: That Mario3 time attack was something called a "Tool Assisted Speedrun" or TAS for short.  There are many of them located at [url=http://bisqwit.iki.fi/nesvideos/]Bisqwit's Tool Assisted Movies page[/url].  Some of them are absolutely mind-blowing.

title: Re: yes
content:
SMB3 in 11 minutes??? Thats the one with the large ships and the racoon mario, right? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img]

Reminds me of beating Super Mario 64 with 16 stars (but i can't do it since i can't get the rabbit through the door bug to work)[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v609/genius314/picturekeen.bmp[/img]

title: Time Attacks
content:
Just so you know, time attacks are not completed in one sitting. It's a way of doing it on an emulator so that, if you mess up, you press rewind and try it again.

Technically, everything you do in this game is possible... just not humanly possible. You'd need computer-like precision to do Super Mario Bros. III all in one shot. They're still cool, though.

title: Re: Time Attacks
content: I wish DOSbox had a "save state" feature. Its a lot easier than loading your game again (especially in keen 1-3 [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dead.gif[/img]  )[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v609/genius314/picturekeen.bmp[/img]
